title: Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonics
b. No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (already done in the type wizard for superclass) and should be implemented. At least isValidTypeName

c. Browse button should have a standard size (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes)
d. Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'

e. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
f. The destination type can be a source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
OB:
The browse button size is too small
c. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'
e. Types from other projects' source folders are also shown in the dialog.
f. Refactoring warns that selecting a source type as the destination type will result in errors and makes changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
The browse button should have a standard size
c. When going to the next page, it should not display 'Type not found'
e. Only types from the source folders of the current project should be shown in the dialog.
f. Refactoring should not warn about errors when selecting a source type as the destination type and should not make changes in all referencing classes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member.
2. Observe the size of the browse button.
3. Proceed to the next page and observe the displayed message.
4. Observe that types from other projects' source folders are also shown in the dialog.
5. Try selecting a source type as the destination type and observe the displayed warning message and changes made in referencing classes.
